Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case
Info Source: Extracted from an NLRB dataset covering 1999-2011 downloaded at https://catalog.data.gov/dataset/nlrb-cats-final-c-case-data-bulk-19990101-20110930-in-xml

Description: Toys R Us, Inc.  agreed to pay a $1.3 million civil penalty to settle Federal Trade Commission charges that it violated a 1998 order governing its dealings with its suppliers. The order prohibited Toys R Us from urging any supplier to limit supply of products or refuse to sell to discounters.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2011/03/toys-r-us-pay-13-million-penalty-violating-ftc-order
https://www.eeoc.gov/eeoc/newsroom/release/10-29-13.cfm
Notes: Description field shows type of discrimination that EEOC had alleged.

Description: Seven large Internet e-tailers agreed to settle Federal Trade Commission allegations that they violated the Mail and Telephone Order Rule during the 1999 holiday shopping season by providing buyers inadequate notice of shipping delays or continuing to promise specific delivery dates when timely fulfillment was impossible.
Info Source: https://www.ftc.gov/news-events/press-releases/2000/07/seven-internet-retailers-settle-ftc-charges-over-shipping-delays

Description: Toys R Us agreed to pay over $95,800 in restitution and $8,000 penalty in settlement of allegations it did not provide earned vacation pay to employees who left the company.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20090421223804/http://www.mass.gov/?pageID=cagopressrelease&L=1&L0=Home&sid=Cago&b=pressrelease&f=2009_03_30_toysrus_agreement&csid=Cago

Description: A group of major retailers and a group of jewelry manufacturers joined a settlement involving the presence of lead in costume jewelry sold to children.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-lockyer-announces-settlement-major-us-companies-reduce-lead

Description: Toys R Us agreed to pay $75,000 to both Los Angeles and San Diego counties, and $28,730 costs split between four Weight and Measures departments, in settlement of allegations it overcharged customers with significant checkstand pricing errors.
Info Source: http://da.lacounty.gov/content/toys-r-us-parent-company-settles-consumer-protection-lawsuit
